item.title: Tariq Ramadan’s Burden
item.dc:creator: Wendell Marsh
item.description: During a recent debate on the Senegalese television channel TFM about the ongoing violence in Palestine, Tariq Ramadan accused one of his interlocutors Bakary Sambe of the most offensive crime for an African intellectual: having a colonized mind. Sambe, a professor at Senegalâ€™s Gaston Berger University and coordinator of the Observatory of Radicalisms and Religious … Continue reading Tariq Ramadan’s Burden →

item.title: Good War/Bad Terror: Morality, Violence, and the (De)Valuation of Palestinian Life
item.dc:creator: Marianna Reis
item.description: Last Friday, the Israeli Air Force killed two members of the Palestinian Resistance Committee in Gaza, who were believed to be planning an attack on Israel from the Egyptian Sinai some time in the following days. This sparked an onslaught of rocket attacks from Gaza into Southern Israel, and Israeli airstrikes on Gaza, with civilian … Continue reading Good War/Bad Terror: Morality, Violence, and the (De)Valuation of Palestinian Life →
